alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 03 at 2:28AM PST until March 06 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM FRIDAY TO 11 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 2 PM Friday to 11 AM PST Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
